title: Advanced Mathematics Education Design Using Blended Learning and Learner-Centered Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Non-Degree Program Integrating Theory and Practical Projects in VR-Based Simulation Environments, Offering Personalized Feedback Based on Individual Learner Capabilities

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more strategies for solving complex mathematical problems using a learner-centered approach in a blended learning environment.

Graduate students will visualize three multivariable calculus concepts (partial derivatives, multiple integrals, gradients) using VR simulation tools (e.g., Unity MARS, Unreal Engine), apply them to real-world engineering/physics cases (e.g., fluid dynamics, electromagnetic field simulation), and submit project outcomes within six months, achieving ≥80 points based on instructor evaluation criteria (creativity 30%, accuracy 40%, practicality 30%)
Learners document individual learning patterns in reflection journals at least twice while solving mathematical modeling problems through collaborative learning with peers.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
